model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains attributes, relationship and methods of a game.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    Angelica Corrales Quevedo, https://github.com/AngelicaCorrales, Keren Lopez Cordoba, https://github.com/KerenLopez

    • Method Detail

      • saveWinners

        private void saveWinners()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method serializes or saves all the information about the winner of each round in the game.
        name: saveWinners
        post: The winner of a round was saved.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException -
        thrown if... 1. A local file that was no longer available is being read.
        2. Any process closed the stream while a stream is being used to read data.
        3. The disk space was no longer available while trying to write to a file.

      • loadWinners

        public boolean loadWinners()
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method loads all the information about the winners of the game.
        name: loadWinners
        post: The winners of the game were loaded.
        Returns:
        a boolean specifying loaded, a variable that indicates if the file with the given path was found.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException -
        thrown if... 1. A local file that was no longer available is being read.
        2. Any process closed the stream while a stream is being used to read data.
        3. The disk space was no longer available while trying to write to a file.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException -
        thrown if the path of the file wasn't found.

      • startGame

        public void startGame(int rows,
                      int cols,
                      int snakes,
                      int ladders,
                      java.lang.String p)
        This method creates a game board depending on the information provided.
        name: startGame
        pre: the variables rows, cols, snakes, ladders and p are already initialized.
        post: The game board was created.
        Parameters:
        snakes - Is an Integer variable that contains the number of snakes for the game. snakes greater than 0.
        ladders - Is an Integer variable that contains the number of ladders for the game. ladders greater than 0.
        rows - Is an Integer variable that contains the number of rows for the game. rows greater than 1.
        cols - Is an Integer variable that contains the number of columns for the game. columns greater than 1.
        p - Is a String variable that contains the players for the game. p!="" and p!=null.

      • assignSymbol

        private java.lang.String assignSymbol(java.lang.String p,
                                      int playersN,
                                      int cont)
        This method assigns a symbol to each player in a random way.
        name: assignSymbol
        pre: the variables p, playersN and cont are already initialized.
        post: Each player has an assigned symbol.
        Parameters:
        playersN - Is an Integer variable that contains the number of players for the game. playersN greater than 0.
        cont - Is an Integer variable that will contain the number of players that have already been assigned a symbol.
        p - Is a String variable that will contain each player's symbols for the game.
        Returns:
        a String specifying p, a variable with the players' symbols for the game.

      • searchSymbol

        private boolean searchSymbol(java.lang.String p,
                             char s,
                             int cont,
                             int times)
        This method searches for a specific symbol within the text string that contains the symbols of the other players.
        name: searchSymbol
        pre: the variables p, s, cont and times are already initialized.
        post: True or false was returned depending of the result of the verification.
        Parameters:
        times - Is an Integer variable that will contains the number of times that a given symbol is found in the text string.
        cont - Is an Integer variable that will contain the position of a letter within the text string.
        p - Is a String variable that contains the symbols of all the players for the game.
        s - Is a char variable that contains a specific symbol of a player. p!='' p!=null.
        Returns:
        a boolean specifying find, a variable that indicates if a certain symbol has already been assigned to a player.

      • throwDie

        public java.lang.String throwDie()
        This method randomly chooses a number from 1 to 6 that indicates the box to which a player should go.
        name: throwDie
        post: A number was chosen and a message is returned indicating the player's score or the number of moves that the player made to win the game.
        Returns:
        a String specifying msg, a variable that contains the score of a player or the number of moves that the player made to win the game.

      • returnPlayer

        private char returnPlayer()
        This method returns the symbol of the player who is playing.
        name: returnPlayer
        post: The symbol of the player who is playing at the moment was returned.
        Returns:
        a char specifying p, a variable that contains the player who is playing at the moment.

      • endGame

        public boolean endGame()
        This method indicates if the game is over or not.
        name: endGame
        post: True or false was returned depending on the state of the game.
        Returns:
        a boolean specifying end, a variable that indicates if the game is over or not.

      • addWinner

        public void addWinner(java.lang.String nickname)
               throws java.io.IOException
        This method adds a winner to the binary tree.
        name: addWinner
        pre: The variable nickname is already initialized.
        post: The winner player was added.
        Parameters:
        nickname - Is a String variable that contains the name of a winner player. p!="" and p!=null.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException -
        thrown if... 1. A local file that was no longer available is being read.
        2. Any process closed the stream while a stream is being used to read data.
        3. The disk space was no longer available while trying to write to a file.

      • addWinner

        private void addWinner(Winner current,
                       Winner newWinner)
        This method adds a winner to the binary tree in case the root of the binary tree already has a value assigned to it.
        name: addWinner
        pre: The objects current and newWinner are already initialized.
        post: The winner player was added.
        Parameters:
        current - Is a Winner object that represents the root of the binary tree of winners. current!=null.
        newWinner - Is a Winner object that represents the new winner player that is going to be added to the binary tree. newWinner!=null.

      • listWinnersInorder

        public java.lang.String listWinnersInorder()
        This method returns the binary tree of winners.
        name: listWinnersInOrder
        post: All the winners that are in the binary tree were returned.
        Returns:
        a String specifying listOfWinners, a variable that contains all the winners that are in the binary tree.

      • listWinnersInorder

        private void listWinnersInorder(Winner current,
                                Winner parent)
        This method searches and concatenates the winners in an inorder way.
        name: listWinnersInOrder
        pre: The objects like current and parent are already initialized.
        post: The winners were concatenated in an inorder way.
        Parameters:
        current - Is a Winner object that represents the root of the binary tree of winners.
        parent - Is a Winner object that represents the object that is up of another winner object.
